# miniRSA

> Cryptography | 300 Points
-----------------------------

## Problem Statement
>Lets decrypt this: [ciphertext](./ciphertext)? Something seems a bit small
###### HINT
> RSA tutorial
>
> How could having too small an e affect the security of this 2048 bit key?
>
>Make sure you dont lose precision, the numbers are pretty big (besides the e value)
## Analysis

The given e is very small and value of n is vary very large so there is a
posibility that 

This
>`c = S^3 % n`

Translates to the following provided that  `S^3 < n`
>`c = S^3`

And to find the Secret message(S) we can find cube root of cypher text(c)
>`S = c^(1/3)`

## Solution
We can see that in our case  `S^3 < n`
we can find the cyphertext just by finding the cube root of the cypher text

```
N: 
e: 3
ciphertext (c): 2205316413931134031074603746928247799030155221252519872650082343781881947286623459260358458095368337105247516735006016223547924074432814737081052371203373104854490121754016011241903971190586239974732476290129461147622505210058893325312869 
```

* Find the cube root of ciphertext
```
c^(1/3) = 13016382529449106065894479374027604750406953699090365388203726390645239922123389
```

* Convert the number to hex and then hex decode it to get the flag
```
hex(cube_root_c) = 0x7069636f4354467b6e3333645f615f6c41726733725f655f64623438623139627dL
```


## Flag
`picoCTF{n33d_a_lArg3r_e_db48b19b}`

## Resources
* [Online Tool](https://www.dcode.fr/cube-root) to fine cube root of large numbers
